channel.description: Last 10 notes on Eritque Arcus Math Notes

item.title: Vandermonde matrix
item.description: Definition Matrix A n\times n has basis function t^i. Every term is t_i^j where j \in [0, n - 1] and i \in [1,n]. Example >>> import numpy >> numpy.vander([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], increasing=True) array([[ 1, 1, 1, 1, 1], [ 1, 2, 4, 8, 16], [ 1, 3, 9, 27, 81], [ 1, 4, 16, 64, 256], [ 1, 5, 25, 125, 625]]).

item.title: readme
item.description: This note is outcome of Spring 25 CS 450. Numerical Analysis in UIUC taught by instructor Paul Fischer. The book is Scientific Computing: An Introductory Survey, Revised Second Edition Topics by type recap Type of matrix: Orthogonal matrix Symmetric positive definite matrix (SPD) Band matrix Vandermonde matrix Factorization: LU factorization Cholesky factorization Singular value decomposition (SVD) QR factorization Topics by Chapter Chapter 1 Chapter 2 Chapter 3.

item.title: Orthogonal matrix
item.description: A is m\times n Definition A^TA=I and AA^T = I. \det(A) = \pm1 A^{-1} = A^T columns of Orthogonal matrix are mutually orthogonal A^T is Orthogonal matrix .
